meanings.definition: The act of transfixing or being transfixed.
meanings.sent1: Her transfixions on the stage were evident as she watched the play with wide eyes.
meanings.sent2: The transfixions of the audience showed how engaging the performance was.
meanings.sent3: His transfixions on the TV screen made him forget about everything else happening around him.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the painting caused immediate transfixions in all who beheld it.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks held the children in complete transfixions.

meanings.definition: A state of being motionless or fixed in place.
meanings.sent1: The cat's transfixions on the mouse froze it in place.
meanings.sent2: The hiker's transfixions at the stunning view made him stop in his tracks.
meanings.sent3: The transfixions of the statue made it seem like it could come to life at any moment.
meanings.sent4: The transfixions of fear kept her rooted to the spot.
meanings.sent5: The transfixions of the traffic jam caused delays for hours.

meanings.definition: A feeling of being captivated or mesmerized.
meanings.sent1: The book's transfixions kept her up all night reading.
meanings.sent2: His transfixions on the painting made him lose track of time.
meanings.sent3: The transfixions of the movie were so strong that she didn't notice her phone ringing.
meanings.sent4: The transfixions of the music held the audience in a spellbound silence.
meanings.sent5: The transfixions of the starlit sky left them breathless with wonder.
